SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.nhksos.quantumrex.Casino
Class DataManager

java.lang.Object
  com.nhksos.quantumrex.Casino.DataManager

public class DataManager
extends Object

DataManager is the central database for this plugin's data. All necessary data is stored in a series of HashMaps that are read from and written to files via the Serializable interface.

Author:
quantumrex

Field Detail

parent

private CasinoManager parent

description

private static PluginDescriptionFile description
Standard bukkit Description file reference

gamekey

private Game.GameIDAccess gamekey
Accessor to reset the ID generation System for Games. Implemented for security.

casinokey

private Casino.CasinoIDAccess casinokey
Accessor to reset the ID generation System for Casinos. Implemented for security.

activators

private HashMap<SerialVector,ID> activators
A HashMap containing all game activators mapped to their respective GameIDs. An activator is the button, switch, or pressure pad that begins a game. This is used for looking up a gameID by the PLAYER_INTERACT event.

owners

private HashMap<String,ID> owners
A HashMap containing all of the Casino Owners Names, mapped to the ID of the casino that they own. Used to check if a specific Player owns a Casino.

casinos

private HashMap<ID,Casino> casinos
A HashMap containing all CasinoIDs, mapped to their respective Casinos. This map contains all Casinos that the plugin is managing.

games

private HashMap<ID,Game> games
A HashMap containing all existing GameIDs mapped to the games that they represent. This contains all games being managed by the plugin. Each game is aware of the Casino it belongs to, as well as all of the properties contained by the Casino.

jobs

private HashMap<String,Job> jobs
A HashMap containing all of the currently running tasks that the database is keeping track of. These are used to direct player input and events to the proper Casino or Game. Jobs are looked up by player name.

running

private HashMap<String,ID> running
A HashMap containing all currently running games managed by the database. These are used to direct player input to the game, either thru chat events, or Player interacts.

stats

private HashMap<String,Stats> stats
Not yet implemented.

writer

private ConfigWriter writer
The writer in charge of saving and loading game data for the Database.

config

public Configuration config
A Configuration object based off of a default config.yml in the plugin's data directory.

Constructor Detail

DataManager

public DataManager(CasinoManager p)
Starts the database, loads all saved data and config options, reinitializes all data members, and performs general maintenance to allow the program to run correctly.

Parameters:
p - The CasinoManager that spawned this DataManger. Used for server access.
Method Detail

stop

public boolean stop()
This function performs the final shutdown functions of the database. It saves the current state of the ID generators, writes all critical data to a file, and kills the writer.

Returns:
Returns false if there was a problem saving data, true otherwise.

receiveKey

public void receiveKey(Casino.CasinoIDAccess key)
Method to get the accessor for the ID creation system. This is vital for casino and game storage, so it is well protected.

Parameters:
key - The data accessor for the Casino class.

receiveKey

public void receiveKey(Game.GameIDAccess key)
Method to get the accessor for the ID creation system. This is vital for casino and game storage, so it is well protected.

Parameters:
key - The data accessor for the Game class.

load

private void load()
Instructs the writer to read each of the critical HashMaps from their respective files.

save

private void save()
Passes each of the critical HashMaps to the writer for output to a file. Performs pre-processing to remove unfinished Games and Casinos from the HashMaps before storace, to prevent errors on loading.

reinitialize

public void reinitialize()
This method finishes restoring previously saved data to full operational status. Many components of the items stored in Games and Casinos are non-Serializable. Among these are Blocks and Players, which are critical to Game operation. It is possible, however, to save a string containing a Player's name, or a SerialVector which represents a block. These can be used to restore the objects and bring the games back online.

registerCasino

public void registerCasino(ID id,
                           Block block)
This function is used to register a block with a Casino object. CMPlayerListener calls this function to pass a corner block to the Casino. The return value send by the Casino function determines whether the casino building job has been completed. If so, the job is cancelled.

Parameters:
id - ID of the Casino being built
block - The block being passed to the Casino for processing;

nameCasino

public void nameCasino(ID id,
                       String name)
Passes a String to a Casino specified by ID in order to name it.

Parameters:
id - - The ID of the Casino being named;
name - - The new name of the casino

hasCasino

public boolean hasCasino(String name)
Checks owners to see if a Player given by name owns a Casino. Playes must create a Casino before they can make games for it.

Parameters:
name - - The player being checked
Returns:
- True if owners contains a mapping for the Player referenced by name, false otherwise

getCasino

public Casino getCasino(String name)
This method returns the Casino owned by the current user. This method does not check to see if the user has a Casino, It simply returns the value received from the HashMap. This can be null. This function should always be preceded by a call to hasCasino(name).

Parameters:
name - - The name of the owner of the sought Casino
Returns:
The Casino object owned by this player, or null if none is available.

getCasino

public Casino getCasino(ID id)
This method returns the Casino referenced by the given ID. This method assumed that the ID is an ID for an existing Casino object.

Parameters:
id - - The ID of the sought Casino
Returns:
The Casino object listed under this ID, or null if none is available.

testCasino

public void testCasino(String string)

destroyCasino

public void destroyCasino(String string)

createGame

public void createGame(Job job,
                       GameType type)
This function creates an un-initialized game of the type specified. This method is called when a player enters a type via the chat system, whether this ocurrs through the original makemachine command, or through a type statement. Once the game is initialized, the function asks the user to select an activator block for the new game.

Parameters:
job - - The job that is creating this Game.
type - - The GameType that is being created.

registerGame

public void registerGame(String name,
                         ID id,
                         Block block)
This method checks to see if there is a game named by the current ID. If there is not, it is assumed that the user has not specified a type for the game, and therefore createGame() has not run. The return value of the game function represents its ready state. If true, the game has all the data it needs to run, and this job can be cancelled.

Parameters:
name - - Name of the player building the game.
id - - ID of the Game in progress
block - - The block being passed to the Game for processing.

registerActivator

public void registerActivator(SerialVector vector,
                              ID id)
This method places a game activator and a Game ID into the activators field. Once this is accomplished, players can enable the machine in question by pressing that button.

Parameters:
vector - - Activator to be placed in the HashMap.
id - - The ID of the game to be activated.

isGameActivator

public boolean isGameActivator(SerialVector vector)
Used by CMPlayerListener to determine if a block the player has interacted with should enable a game.

Parameters:
vector - - Block the listener is concerned with.
Returns:
- True if the block is a registered activator, False otherwise.

playGame

public void playGame(SerialVector vector,
                     Player player)
This function is called by CMPlayerListener when it determines that a game activator has been pressed. It first checks to see if a player is already playing a game. Players are only allowed to run one game at once. It then checks the status of the game, and if the game is in the ready state, it adds the player to the running HashMap and calls the activated game's enable method.

Parameters:
vector - - SerialVector representing the activator that was pressed.
player - - Player that activated the game.

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying(String player)
Function to test if a player is currently playing a game.

Parameters:
player - - The Player being tested.
Returns:
- True if the player is playing a game, False otherwise.

playInteract

public void playInteract(String player,
                         Event event)
Called by various listeners to pass events to a game being played. These will be interpreted by the game. Games are looked up by searching for the player's name in the running HashMap. It is assumed that the given Player is playing a game. This call should always be preceded by a call to isPlaying(...).

Parameters:
player - - The player who fired the event.
event - - The event that was fired.

finishGame

public void finishGame(String name)
This function is called by the game to notify the database that it has finished its execution. This removes the player from the running HashMap, and frees them to play other games. A game must always call this when it is finished.

Parameters:
name - - The name of the player who was playing the game.

destroyGame

public void destroyGame()

registerJob

public void registerJob(Player player,
                        JobType job,
                        String[] args)
This function is called by CasinoManager to register jobs with the database. Player commands that need to create jobs are handled here. It creates a new job, and creates an ID for the job. it then adds the job to the jobs HashMap, under the player's name. Any arguments that the player entered with the command are also processed, if possible. This function, after creating the job, also issues instructions to the player, stating how to continue working with their job.

Parameters:
player - - Player who issued the command
job - - The type of job that was requested
args - - Any arguments that were issued with the command

hasJob

public boolean hasJob(String player)
Called to check if a given player is currently working on a job.

Parameters:
player - - Player being tested.
Returns:
- True if the player is working, False otherwise.

finishJob

private void finishJob(String player)
Called when a player finishes a job. This removes them from the job HashMap, and frees them to perform other jobs.

Parameters:
player -

getJob

public Job getJob(String player)
Returns the job that the current player is working on. This method assumes that the given player refers to someone working on a job, so the return can be null. For safety, this method should be preceded by a call to hasJob(...).

Parameters:
player - - The player whose Job we are searching for.
Returns:
- The job being performed by the player.

cancelJob

public boolean cancelJob()
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED!!!

Returns:
- null

placeBet

public boolean placeBet()
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED!!!

Returns:
- null

getScheduler

public BukkitScheduler getScheduler()
Gets the server scheduler from CasinoManager. For use by games when events need to be registered.

Returns:
- The BukkitScheduler instance returned by the server.

getPlugin

public CasinoManager getPlugin()
Gets the CasinoManager for this plugin. Allows games that can access the database to interact with other plugins.

Returns:
- The CasinoManagaer representing this plugin.

getWorld

public World getWorld(String world)
Returns the world on this server represented by the given string. This is not a very robust call, needs to be updated.

Parameters:
world - - The string representing the world being searched for.
Returns:
- The World if it exists, null otherwise.

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer(String name)
Returns the Plater represented by the given string, or null if the player is not present

Parameters:
name - - The name of the Player sought
Returns:
- The Player, if he exists, otherwise null.

getBlock

public Block getBlock(SerialVector wvector,
                      String world)
               throws NullPointerException
Returns the block in the World represented by world at the coordinates specified in wvector.

Parameters:
wvector - - Coordinates of the desired block
world - - World containing the desired block
Returns:
Block at the specified wvector in the given world, or null if it doesn't exist.
Throws:
NullPointerException - - if world does not represent a world on the current server, and possibly if there is a problem with wvector.
